original_title: Powerful Water Pump Is Modular In Nature
original_content:
If youve got one decently powerful DC motor, you could conceivably build a water pump. Gang up ten of them, however, and you could build something considerably more powerful, as [akashv44] demonstrates.
The design is straightforward, relying on simple impeller pumps driven by RS-775 DC motors. The pump housings and impellers are all 3D printed. Theyre designed so that the motor integrates neatly with the pump housing, and so that multiple pumps can easily be ganged up into a single larger unit. [akashv44] demonstrates a build using ten individual pump units with a large manifold, allowing the output of all the pumps to be combined into one single outlet.
The concept is straightforward enough, and running on a 48-volt power supply, its clear that the pump can move a significant amount of water. Notably, though, it would be possible to improve significantly with some design changes. Currently, the water path from the pumps must make several 90-degree turns, harming efficiency. Wed love to see the pumps angled nicely into more advanced manifolds which would more smoothly combine the streams together. This would likely result in a far greater output from the system.
In any case, 3D printing pumps is an increasingly popular pastime around here.
title: 「10個のDCモーターでより強力な水ポンプを作る方法」
body: 10個のDCモーターを組み合わせて作った水ポンプを紹介。3Dプリンティングしたポンプハウジングとインペラーを使用し、マニホールドで一つの流れに統合している。現在は効率が悪いが、ポンプの角度を調整することで改善が可能。3Dプリンティングでのポンプ作りが人気。
titles: 「10個のDCモーターでより強力な水ポンプを作る方法」
「RS-775 DCモーターを使用して水ポンプを作る方法」
「モーターを簡単にポンプに統合できる3Dプリントの水ポンプハウジング」
「マニフォールドによって複数の水ポンプをシームレスに結合する方法」
「より効率的な水ポンプを作るためのポンプの配管設計の改善方法」
